messages

Class MessageFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • messages.MessageFactory

  • public class MessageFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A Singleton class that can be called from virtually anywhere to display messages to the screen.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createMessage(java.lang.String string, Message.MessageType type)
      Creates a new message to be displayed
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Draws a message to the screen
      void flush()
      Removes any messages that are still waiting to appear
      void flushOutput()
      Removes any output error messages that are still waiting to appear
      static MessageFactory getInstance()
      Gets the single instance of a MessageFactory.
      void update()
      Decides when a message has been displayed enough and when it should be removed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MessageFactory getInstance()
        Gets the single instance of a MessageFactory.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of a MessageFactory

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws a message to the screen
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics of the screen

      • update

        public void update()
        Decides when a message has been displayed enough and when it should be removed. Messages normally last for three seconds

      • createMessage

        public void createMessage(java.lang.String string,
                          Message.MessageType type)
        Creates a new message to be displayed
        Parameters:
        string - The actual message
        type - The type of the message

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Removes any messages that are still waiting to appear

      • flushOutput

        public void flushOutput()
        Removes any output error messages that are still waiting to appear
